10/10

L4D and its sequel are two of the best zombie games I have ever played (with Dead Rising 2 as another).  The campaigns are a good length, allowing for short sittings that get you from start to finish (the ~85 minutes I have on record cover a single campaign, with one death).

I haven't played online multiplayer, but I've played couch co-op on 360, and it's a really good MP; there's an actual incentive to keep your teammates alive (at least the human played ones).

The AI can, unfortunately, be kinda stupid, but that's par for the course.  Helpfully, they won't activate horde events by themselves.  Unhelpfully, they won't activate *any* buttons by themselves.  But generally, they can be counted upon to not do really stupid things (like attacking the normally docile, very dangerous Witch enemy when she's not already aggressive), and they will certainly try to help you out by rescuing you from enemy grapples, and giving you healing when needed.

I would recommend this game to people looking for some fast-paced, zombie-killin' action that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Gather round kids let me tell you a story of 4 survivors as they make their way across a zombie infected America, shootin & lootin as they go. But survival is hard without guns but that’s no problem thanks to our friends at the NRA keepin us supplied with all the latest in personal defence weaponry like a M60 or a grenade launcher, but these kinds of people wouldn’t be able to last long with that type of firepower being restricted because of some NON-ZOMBIE related incidences now would they.        

Now kids let me tell you about these 4 fine gun toting Mericans and why they need guns in day-to-day life:

First off theirs Bill, a PATRIOTIC WARHERO who served this country with distinction and honour and now gets to come home and defend his countrymen once more thanks to our wide range of military rifles available at all good grocery stores.

Up next is Zoey a 18 year old college student now why would a college student need a gun, good question, she needs it for when she gets really stressed from an exam or from her peers and needs to vent some stress by killing a class full of zombies. Besides she’s a woman and in order to be a progressive society we need to include women in everything including “gun violence”.(you do want be progressive don’t you?)

Then there’s louis, Louis is a drug addict that is always trying to grab some pills even if he doesn’t know what they are(could be viagra), but that shouldn’t stop him from owning any type of weapon. In fact most people who object to Louis having a gun only do so because he’s black THAT’S RACIST, and racism isn’t cool kids remember that.

And last but not least is Francis, he may look shady but how can you judge a man by his appearance, besides it would just be a violation of his privacy to pry into his private live for the purpose of performing a “ridiculous” background check (even if he does look like a criminal).

So what does this game teach us kids………..it teaches us that guns can kill zombies by the truckload so we all need to do our part by making sure everyone can defend themselves from a threat that technically doesn’t existent yet. So when your parents ask you what you want for your birthday you know what to say.



Yours truly 
National Rifle Association

So when I saw I could get it on my Mac I jumped on it only to have to deal with it crashing every single time i try to load it. Major downer to say the least. This game is a zombie survival title requiring you to remain in your team of four in order to increase your chances of survival. It basically plays like Half-Life 2 and looks like an upgraded version of Counter-Strike: Source. Not sure why the system requirements are much higher than Half-Life 2: Episode Two as the real differences are film grain and slightly more detail in the environment...plus shadows that actually change based on the light source. This game doesn't have quick save so you have to be on your guard the whole time. It can get frustrating near the last level of each campaign where you have to fight off waves of zombie hoards and tank monsters. There are some cheap moments where a tank monster will instantly punish you with zero health then having to restart the level (remember there are no checkpoints) so this game is not without its flaws. There are also a few raging moments where there would coincidently be a witch, hunter and smoker for example and then you get gang raped from all directions. The difficultly can be a sudden spike up in some cases if you are new to this game on even normal difficulty. There is also a very limited arsenal of weapons like the sniper rifle, m16a2, colt 45, Uzi, pump action shotgun, and auto shotty, pipe bomb and molotov cocktail. If you can tolerate some of these flaws, then this game is worth checking out.

Proof that old games are fun.

Going into this game, I expected an average zombie shooter game. This game came out around the time that zombies were really popular I think? I don't know, I heard alot of kids talking about zombies when this game came out and I still hear talk about mostly L4D2 to this very day.

I love this game. As of this review, I may not have a whole lot of time in this game but from my inital completion of the first single-player campaign "No Mercy", I can tell this is a much more different game than I originally thought due to the cooperative gameplay elements that make this game standout from all other zombie survival games I have seen.

This game is really fucking fun, you just straight up murder zombies and it really feels satisfying seeing as how when you kill these zombies, you are in turn helping your teammates avoid a brutal death to a hoarde. Helping these guys out in need kind of makes you feel a little better as a player. This game has more to keep you on your toes than you'd think, you have to watch over your teammates, the guys that are the difference between winning and losing, survival or death because playing this game solo is really no fun at all. It gives this game a unique challenge factor to it that I can't believe wasn't thought of before. It makes the game different, but alot more fun.

Rock on Valve, I almost feel like they can tackle anything and come out with an impressive piece of work. I cannot wait to play L4D2 and try out this game's multiplayer.

I assume however the multiplayer would make this game alot more interesting, seeing as how there are humans playing and not robots. I am looking forward to my first round in multiplayer.

But thats just my silly little review, if you actually read it, what were you doing in that time? You could've spent that time actually buying this game and playing it. Infact, do that now because I have nothing left to say at the moment. I might edit my review once I try out the multiplayer and talk about the community aspect of this game.
Very good entertainment for coop with your friends , very intense and fun!

This is the most awesome zombie shooter of all times!!! 
Like it more than L4D2 because:
1. graphics and dynamics (here you can see your legs, all the objects can be moved and shooted, all the zombies are very different from each other, detailed surroundings, etc.). 
2. statistics in the end of each chapter is more interestinf than in L4D2.
3. versus score scale is more complicated and challenging
4. atmosphere is rather gloom and apocalyptic - so it's harder to see the specials (everything is of the same colour gamma).
So, you are gonna love this game with all your heart! 
P.S.: not so many children plays this 1st part (the majority prefers the 2nd because of the bright colours and mainstream).

I don't care who you are, how old you are, where you come from or what your gaming experience is. You need to play this game.

In my opinion, this game completely reinvented (maybe even pioneered) cooperative multiplayer. You can expect hundreds of hours of fun with friends.

This game isn't only about how good your aim is, how fast you are, or how well you know the level. It's mostly about how well you know your friends, tough decision making skills, and whether you can stick together and work together as a group.

There's a random generator concept included in level design, meaning enemies don't spawn in the same places when you play a level. This keeps the game interesting as you're never sure what the expect. Level design is excellent, the characters are great and lovable. The story is simple but enough to get you hooked.

If I have to find something negative about the game, I would say that it lacks a good soundtrack.

It all started here, the game that played an important role during my high school years. 

Now this game is just a shell of its former glory and competitiveness, as many have moved on in life just as I did. This game is still in deep slumber, awaiting the day of its long-deserved revival and comeback.

Top game:

This game was a great steam even at its full price, which is around twenty dollars. It's a great game that I keep going back to on a regular basis, even though I have the second title in the series. This game mainly focuses on teamwork, which makes the experience even better. The AI is challenging and the weapon selection makes you adapt depending on what you like. A great game to play at any time, and if you have three friends in a LAN party, it's even better.

A classic that redefined co-op gaming for me. Surviving the zombie horde with friends always feels like an accomplishment, but I never knew I would play a game where I wanted to be on the other side. Now, it's hard to remember a world without Boomers, Hunters, Smokers, and Tanks.

One of the best co-op experiences I ever had.
Valve knows how to make a great co-op game.
I can really only recommend this to everybody.
The best thing you can do is play with friends.
And don't forget about the even better sequel.
This series is still one of the best co-op games.
Great game needed some work and the second game made up for it.

L4D is a solid game. It's more-or-less created a genre. Yet I can't recommend this game. It was quickly dropped by the developers to cash-in on Left 4 Dead 2 followed by the cheesiest, thinnest attempt at PR spinning that I've see in awhile. The game itself wasn't bad at all -- it was great. It's just one of those situations that leaves a bad taste mixed with bitter memories and there are such better options these days.
